text:
Stephen Leo Bing (March 31, 1965 – June 22, 2020) was an American businessman, movie producer, screenwriter and political donor to progressive causes. He was the founder of Shangri-La Entertainment. He also produced many Hollywood movies such as "The Polar Express", "Kangaroo Jack", "Shine A Light" and "Rules Don't Apply".
Bing committed suicide on June 22, 2020 by jumping off his apartment building in Los Angeles, aged 55.
